column4: Hi -- i mounted a jumpdrive (mount -t vfat /dev/sdb /media/jumpdrive -o rw) but i cannot create any files or anything on it unless i use sudo
otherwise i get permissions errors.. but the directory is chmod 777
the directory is 777? Shouldn't you make it -R 777?
is the partition ext3? You can't do that 777 thing in ntfs partitions
I'm not sure if fat partitions would also take care of permissions the same way ext3
this can't be the first time someone has mounted a vfat jumpdrive
yes. I have one myself. But I can't for example, put a link on my http server pointing for a folder on that partition. It doesn't work. People who try to access get the no permissions error
shouldn't you be mounting /dev/sdbX instead of just sdb?
/dev/sdb is what shows up on kern.log when i plug the usb drive in
run "sudo fdisk -l" (lowercase L not uppercase i) and mount the sdbX that appears
you're screwed. I had a mp3 player that looked like that and I could never mount it
